# Displaying a checkbox in your Mac app built with Mac Catalyst

**Article**

Present a switch control as a Mac-style checkbox when your app runs in the Mac user interface idiom.

## Overview

A Mac app built with Mac Catalyst that uses the Mac user interface idiom displays a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch] as a checkbox when the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/preferredStyle] value is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/Style-swift.enum/automatic] (the default value) or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/Style-swift.enum/checkbox]. If your app doesn’t use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserInterfaceIdiom/mac] idiom, the switch appears as a slider switch. To learn more, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/choosing-a-user-interface-idiom-for-your-mac-app].

### Add text to the checkbox

To display text alongside the checkbox, set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/title] property.

```swift
let showFavoritesAtTop = UISwitch()
showFavoritesAtTop.title = "Always show favorite recipes at the top"
```

### Resize the checkbox

A checkbox-style switch has a default frame size of zero. If you’re not using Auto Layout to determine the size and position of the switch, call [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/sizeToFit()] to resize it so that it uses the appropriate amount of space needed to display the checkbox and its title.
